column5: I had to make an addition to my dad's 15" Legend, lol  Picked up a Eagle Intellimap 500C along with the Navionics Gold+ Chip (Great Lakes + Maritimes).   Dropped by his place yesterday and did the install.  I also found whoever wired the rear of the boat, did it ass backwards.  All this time he's been running his graph unfused (someone put the fuse on the negative side)..  So now I get to re-wire everything and make it pretty.  Oh yeah, if anyone is looking at picking up the Gold+ chip from BPS, I had them price match a place up in Huntsville (Georgian Marine) for $193(BPS is $229).  Got a bit of a hassle from the eletronics guy, saying the Gold was a '08 chip..  I gave him the :what the heck: stare and said the last time this map was updated was '07.  Here is the link to the price match. http://www.georgianmarine.com/securestore/c181598.2.html     Oh yeah, to all the Team #5 members, get your sigs updated with the new banner!!!
I have no toys.. they're all necessities of the sport !
Thats what I tell the wife too Wayne.Told her my new GPS could save my life one day get me back in the fog etc........
Honestly honey,,,thats the same one as last year  :whistling:  lol
Hey! I used the same story!!!
"....and if the boat sinks I can use all those rods tied together as a raft"
cool, i got to get me one of those.

Keep kidding yourself bud...its not a sport,its a hobby.In order for it to be a sport it should not be possible to do it with a beer,coffee and/or  cigarette in hand.The only "athelete" is the one with the hook in its mouth. Joe
Wayne's gps screen is larger than the TV in our family room.
Hahaha must be nice. My buddies got 2 of those 10.4" screens its like watchin TV when you are looking at them.  Good grab Bill, if i may, what did that guy run ya?
For those interested..  I picked up my 500c for 349.00 and my C4 Navionics chip was 150.00 from angling outfitters  G
Hey Mike,  Picked it up online @ RadioWorld.  $299.  I should have picked it up at the SportsMan show, it was $20 cheaper ...
Great, Thanks Bill and G, I am going to start looking for one I think. Strictly to save myself if I ever am lost
Let me know when you wanna test it out somewhere out in the Kawartha's this summer
